intro: Blephariglottis peramoena, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is an evergreen shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. The flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
